name: Gaki
description: I was tasked with designing and developing an e-commerce website for this project. Gaki is a handmade clothing shop for babies and kids. Gaki wanted to differentiate herself from the competition, so she felt the need to build an online shop.We spent three months Working on this project. After many discussions, we had some difficulties getting to a design concept, but we managed to create the perfect solution for Gaki's customers.

caseStudy.description: The first thing I did was observe the company's existing online brand representation. They were using Instagram as their main point of sales. They had a clean and worked image and a lot of user interaction.

caseStudy.title: Result
caseStudy.description: A simple and vibrant first impression of the app that is designed to increase the likelihood of successful adoption. These screens reinforce our app's value and provide instructions that highlight key benefits and features.

name: Lady Blue
description: The Lady Blue Is a handmade clothing shop Focused primarily on women. Their online sales were all made via social media, and they wanted to give the next step, so they contacted me to design, develop, and create their online shop. It was a one month project from the research until the implementation.

caseStudy.title: Product definition
caseStudy.description: I interviewed the owner so we could figure out the key aspects and value proposition of the product. After that, I created an early mockup of the future development.

caseStudy.title: Research
caseStudy.description: These phase is the most variable between projects. It depends on the complexity of the product, timing, available resources and many other factors. In this case, I started with competitive research. It helped me understand these industry standards.

caseStudy.title: Analysis
caseStudy.description: In this phase, we create user personas. You can reference these personas as realistic representations of our target audience. I then created user journeys. It helped me understand the user's point of view.

caseStudy.title: Wireframes
caseStudy.description: After we gather all the information needed, we can directly jump into creating wireframes and start our mockups.

caseStudy.title: Design
caseStudy.description: Let's see how the work came out!
